intro: Impatiens piemeiselii, commonly known as the Peleliu impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the island of Peleliu in the Southwestern Pacific. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited geographic range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
